chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Knack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on case 14CM218

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  Defendant is to allow access to medical records to his agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent. 
Defendant is not to possess or take any medications unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed. 
The Colby/Abbotsford  Police Department Case #14-27 is a read-in into this case.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. Knack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, David M. Knack appeared, pro se  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation
Initial appearance on January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
